text: Brun öl med inslag av rött. Smutsvitt skum. Doft av torkad frukt, lätt kryddighet, lätt rökighet, trä, fikon och mörkt socker. I smaken dök det vid ett tillfälle upp lite soja. Lite för spretig för min smak.

Draught at Hair of the Dog. Dark brown color, white head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, smoke, coffee, chocolate, peat, a bit of dark fruits, toast and hops. Bitter finish with roasted malts, coffee, smoke, peat, toast and hops. Very nice brew, but you get overpowered by the smoke / roast pretty quickly.

Potężny owocowy aromat: suszone śliwki, figi, rodzynki. W tle nuty karmelowe i melasy.
W smaku słodkie, także zdominowane owocami: suszone, kandyzowane. Finisz alkoholowey, rozgrzewający.

Rating #2408 - 2016.04.07 - Bottle from CBI - I had Adam at HOTD in Portland and this is a stellar recreation. Pours a dark reddish brown color. thin head. Unreal aroma of ripened berries, roasted plums,chocolate, caramel. Lots of smoked malt character present, tempered with a spiciness (coriander, clove, nutmeg?). Blown away, this rivals a fine single malt in depth of character and complexity.

Bottle huge thanks to solidfunk not sure if he realized I lost a traditional ale rating recently and needed one badly. Anyways still reeling from excitement of Federer win so pop something nice. Murky brown pour. Nose is dark fruits and woody. Tastes of fig, tobacco, wood, caramel, plum, red wine residue. Smooth palate. Sweeter and rich aftertaste.

dark amber color with tan head
 medium to full body with soft carbonation
aroma is toffee, smoky and woody
quite alcohol good... well balanced beer

Dark amber color with a fine head. Good intensity in the aroma. Full body and a soft carbonation level. A bit oily texture. Sweet, but not cloying. Good complexity in the aroma. Dried fruits, toffee, oak and mild smoke in the back. Lovely evening sipper. Well masked alcohol.[Bottle from a trade with Inbreak]

Bottle. Pours cloudy copper chestnut, small beige head, dissipates fairly quickly, decent lacing. Aroma is rich malts, leather, smoke, toffee, peat. Flavor is medium sweet, light plus bitter, rich and malty. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Excellent.
Tobacco and leather with some roast like boots in the campfire. Black pour with good head and lacing. Some caramel. Bottle.
Dark brown, a bit murky. Aroma of dried fruits, leather, smoke. DElicious caramel, and dark fruits, medium boozy. Rich and sweet, two things i am not.

Aroma: dried fruits, molasses, figs, toffee, toast, some nuts, wood
Taste: medium sweet, molasses, caramel, figs, honey, dried fruits, wood, alcohol, toast
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Oryginalny Adam jednak o wiele lepszy. Wciąż świetne piwo.

Bought when I paid for it. Inky black goop sweet talked out of its hiding place.... I wont hurt you, just process you internally into something else. Enticing, complex aroma - sweetness, figs, toffee, almonds, annnnd its 45 mins later as the alcohol has set in and i kinda forgot as tits just really damn good drinking shit!other stuff and the taste is equalll y smoke, raisins, chooooped wood, lights zingy spice, slight nostril cooking, well.... isnt this a shitty fucking review? god dammmit. goona savour the last sips. well worth the purhase. good enough not to bother to review . instead -enjoy! hard to review a tiny bottle and enjoy deeply at the same time.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours burgundy with low beige head. Aroma is of fruits, alcohol, smoke, leather, toffee, molasses, sugar. Taste is of salt, toffee, molasses, bread, barley sugar, smoke, bitterness. Palate: Full bodied, soft carbonation. Overall: Well done, but this is probably too much for me.

330 mL bottle, bottled on 7/21/2015. Muddy, brown color, with no head. Dried dates and burnt toast leap from the glass, with some layers of licorice, gin, cedar, and allspice. Sweet and spicy up front, with a light bitterness and some boozy warmth through the finish. Heavy body, powdery, creamy, and smooth. This is a bizarre and genuinely unique beer, but very tasty. Great malt character and depth. Singular.

26/IX/15 - on tap @ Borefts 2015 (Bodegraven) - BB: n/a (2015-1839) Thanks to 77ships, Elmanana+1 and the Israeli beer tickers scene for sharing todays beers!
Note: when entering my ratings from Borefts, this beer was still aliased, now it seems to be getting its own ratings. Good thing I keep all my notebooks. :p
Clear purple brown beer, small aery irregular beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, lots of dried fruits, maple syrup, some chocolate. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sourish, alcohol, lots of overripe fruits, banana, pretty bitter. Aftertaste: soft roast, hoppy, maple syrup, bitter and dry finish with a yeast touch. Alcohol noticeable.

Pours a dark brown with a small beige head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of smoke and a little peat even with some caramel and more meaty smoke. Taste is of toffee, caramel, smoke and is moderately sweet. Not too boozy overall but still a little, perfect for sipping. Body is medium-full (I should just say full), carbonation moderate and texture rich/a little syrupy. A nice and rich fireside beer that feels a tad less good than the original but is still a really good option.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks bro! pours unclear medium dark brown with a small light beige cap offering some retention and lacing. brown caramelized maltiness, smoked raisins, burnt caramel, buttery hazelnuts, lots of wood even if not barrel-aged; alcohol well hidden. moderately low carbonation, medium body - very oily; sweet smoky-spicy finish. big, malty, smoky, raisiny - still feels a bit messy. #swill.

Dark brown body, off white head and nice lacing. Aroma of sweet dried fruit, roasty malts, tomatoes, fresh cut grass, molasses. Taste is rich, quite sweet, with a bit of acidity, smoke, roast cocoa. Smooth. Maybe a touch hot/boozy. Tasty, very nice traditional ale.

Poured from the bottle. Dark brown beer with a bit of carbonation, almost no head. Aroma of dried fruit, alcohol, chocolate. Also comes back in the taste which is rich and deep, slightly fresh because of the bit of carbonation. Love it, great beer.
RBSG16 Boozy aroma with dark fruits. Taste is boozy and thin. Medium low carbonation.

330 ml bottle. The beer is dark brown and looks very cloudy, probably a good bit of sediment in there. Small creamy beige head. The aroma is full of brown sugar, caramel and other sweet, toasty malt flavors. Light sweet fig and raisin. Decent hit of whiskey. Mild vanilla, some oak. Nice leathery depth. Taste is quite sweet. Pretty strong booze heat, goes fairly well with the flavors. Almost a light smokiness. Strong dark caramel, light chocolate. Full mouthfeel. A bit sticky and hot, but I sort of like that about the beer.

From a 12 oz bottle at the Grand Tasting during RBSG in Pittsburgh. In my taster was dark brown. Tan head. Nose if big dark fruit. I smell wood too. Full in body and a smooth creamy mouth feel. Flavor is really rich with the ripe fruit, vanilla, and a ton of wood combining for a delicious beer. Finishes with alcohol but it is so rich who cares. A sip of this was enough but I would not mind having a whole bottle of this. It would last a month.

Noses like a barlywine.
Fruit, prunes, yogurt? Blueberries?
Dark brown. Light head.
Toast, banana bread, coco powder, caramel and  subtle mocha...
Fades fast. Boozy boilermaker-like finish.
Light dry bitter finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Bottle at home from chinaski lavapiespours murky red tinged brown with herbal, sweet and musty aroma. Very rich, warming, licorice and rosemary, muddy, boozy -not very nice.
Bottle at RBSG PGH 2016 shared by duffman, thanks! Clear dark brown color, scant edge head. Aroma of dark overripe fruit, burnt caramel, tannins. Taste has plums, raisins, tannins. Tasty. A big beer.

Finally found this beer listing. RBSG2016 grand tasting thanks to the duff, duffman, big thanks! Leather smell. Rootbeer appearance. Flat on the palate. Sweet whiskey taste is over the top. Sweetness and over the top, yet stealth-fully friendly. Wow, how can traddy be so intoxicating?
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours mahogany with a tan head. Nose is caramel, brown sugar, fig, and roasted malts. Flavour is baker's chocolate, dark dried fruit, burned malts, and hints of spice. Moderate body.
Bottle shared at RBSG. The beer is a clear brown with no head. The aroma has raisin, dark fruit, toffee, nuts, and brittle. Sweet and toasty. Big body and medium carbonation.
Bottle - pours caramel brown - nose/taste of toffee, raisin, plum and caramel with some alcohol - med body
Bottle at RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours a dark brown with small beige head. The aroma is wood, caramel, dark fruit. Thick body, vanilla, roast, caramel, boozy finish, very good.

12 oz bottle shared at RBSG. Pours a deep mahogany color with a huge creamy thick tan head. The aroma is caramel, molasses, chocolate, dark fruits, slightly nutty, and honey. The flavor is something special; caramel, molasses, ripe dark fruits, raisins, light chocolate, vanilla, a hint of smoke, and wood. There is a slight alcohol burn in the finish. There is also a bitterness to the finish which balances out some of the sweetness. This is a sipper, but who would want to pound a great beer like this? Medium-full bodied, creamy smooth drinking.
Sampled at rbsg. Dark brown. Tan foam. Huge earthiness with big complex dark fruit. Wood, harshness, hotness, over ripe fruit. One of those beers that make you say wow. An attitude to this one.
33cl bottle @rbsg-pbrgh GT. thin tan ring-copper. A-med malt-fruity, wood. T-follows.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room. Bottled 21.07.2015, BBE 21.07.2020. Aroma is sweet and makty with rye pudding. Also licorice. Flavour has sweet licorice, malt and hoppiness. Finishes with salty licorice. Salty and malty all the way.

(Bottled on/Lotto: 21-07-2015. Best before: 21-07-2020) Un liquide brun acajou avec un mince anneau comme représentation mousseuse. Un début de dentelle. Des arômes et des saveurs de fruits foncés, de cuir et de fumée de bois, de pin, de caramel, de mélasse, de fèves de cacao et dalcool rondouillet. Un corps qui ne souffre pas de son souffle court.  Une agréable texture crémeuse. Une finale fruitée, riche, maltée et fumée tout à fait fantastique.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate and roasted malt.

Appearance:

Opaque brown beer with a slight/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced. The aroma is not very strong and the flavour might be too intense. Thanks to this, it lacks the complexity; though it is very balanced nonetheless.
Bottle - Dark caramel malts with some dark fruit. Cloudy brown with almost no head. Nice dark fruits, touch of manure smoke notes and a nic finish. Very nice.

Bottle at home, 10th June 16. Pours very dark, murky brown. Aroma is strong, medicinal, spice, chocolate, dark fruit, rich. Taste is an explosion of flavour, rich, but not overly sweet, herbal, dark fruit, prune, fig, chocolate. Excellent and unusual beer.

Appearance: translucent amber-brown with deep amber margins, one finger of rocky beige head, excellent retention and well-defined lacing. (4/5) Aroma: rich dark fruit, toffee, figs, leather, nutty, light pine. (7/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, moderate bitter. (7/10) Medium-full body, moderate carbonation, boozy bitter finish. (4/5)

Another oddball style description. Whats this Old World Ale the label refers to, anyway? This thing is big, boozy, and dark - Id be inclined to call it an Abt, had I not previously encountered the Traditional Ale style (which is not, as far as I can tell, a BJCP-recognized style - hey, you try searching the BJCP style guide for traditional and see how far you get!). Regardless of what you call this, its fun - big, boozy fun. Its similar to, but I think even better than, Traquair Jacobite (which BJCP uses as an example for Spice, Herb, or Vegetable Beer, I might add), my previous best-ever Traditional. (15/20)

Bottle to snifter (thanks Ferris). Looks good; a slightly translucent dark amberish brown with foamy beige head. Smells malty with notes of toffee and caramel alongside what comes across like a bit of pleasant oxidation. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant medium-full to full-bodied mouthfeel that drinks easier than 10%. Good beer.

Bottle (330 ml). Split 2-ways with JulienHuxley. Thanks to kbudd19 for this bottle! Dark brown with a small bubbly beige head leaving little lacing. Aroma is rich and super fruity with caramel, piney notes, smoked notes, toasted malts, alcohol and nuts. Taste is moderately sweet with fruits, caramel, toasted malts, alcohol, nuts and mild piney bitterness. Medium to full body. Soft to moderate carbonation. Fruity and nutty finish. A bit to dry for the style. Good, rich and fruity. Not as good as the HotD version.

Bottle shared with Tom. Almost opaque clear dark brown pour with copper hue, thin gold colored head. Aroma is nutty, candied fruits, rich boozy notes, tons of brandy, light toasty notes. Taste is lightly sweet, toasted malt, boozy, not as deep and rich as Id expect a HotD beer to be, slightly overattenuated. Palate is a bit thin, med bodied with light creamy carbonation.
Bottle, shared with the phantomhennes. Very hazy golden brown, dense off white head. Chewy caramel with notes of leather, pine, peat smoke, and dark fruits. Mild to moderate bitter finish. Delicious!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle shared at Mrks. Hazy dark brown, with creme head. Sweet caramel and chocolate malts. Smoked malts. Figgs. Play-doh, licorice, caramel, turmeric. Medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body. Low carbonation. Weird shit!

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Deep ruby brown with fine beige head. Raisins, cardboard, lots of herbs, figs, dried leaves, rye bread, spinach, chicory, sausage, some ash. Medium sweet, over medium bitter with some smoke. Almost full bodied with soft carbonation and oily feel. Not really my thing.
interesting take on Adam, but I like the original /hotd version much more. This has a lot of nice things going for it, but the prominence of the ashy character along with the smoke is a bit much.
Has a cloudy, med brown, nice mellow smoky sweet character, very nice smoke and full malty character. Good
330ml bottle from Park Royal at Matts place. Pours a dark brown with a weak tan head. Aroma and taste are sweet, figs, leather, resin, slightly vegetable. Smoked roasted malt aftertaste. Well done.

Bottle from BC Liquors, Park Royal, bottled 21.07.2015Dark brown color, almost no head. Nice aroma, dark caramel, some smoke, possibly some cheese. Strong body, very good malt flavor, rich, dark caramel, touch of smoke, and some burnt wood in the final; quite strong alcohol feeling. Nice sipper.

12 oz. bottle, pours a reddish dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma brings out lots of leather and some mild smoke. Flavour is fairly boozy, with dark fruits, toffee, smoke and leather. Quite yeasty, dirty and boozy. Not anywhere close to the level of complexity as regular Adam, but its very pleasant.

33cl bottle picked up at the brewery and poured into a snifter glass on 15-Apr-2016.  Dark brown, almost black in colour with a small tan coloured head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, spices and hops. Full body and soft carbonation. Flavour heavy in bitter dark chocolate, molasses, dark fruit, tobacco and vanilla. Creamy bittersweet mouthfeel. A really nice ale - similar in character to an imperial stout. Excellent.

Bottle 0.33l at Samo pivo tasting Belgrade Serbia.01.04.2016.Taste with Ogi,Boban and Vlada ciaooooo.Pour it dark color with small white head.Aroma sweet candy sugar,some spices.Taste of great dark chocolate,toffee,tobacco,vanilla, licorice, raisin, leather, nice smooth finish,full body,nice one.

Rich caramel and toffee aromas. Dark fruit, complex mixture of aromas, and moderate alcohol burn. Chocolate and nutmeg as it warmed. Clear mahogany-brown with almost no head. Sherry-like. Taste is alcohol, rich malt, molasses and plum. Wonderful beer.
Bottle. Black colour with beige head. Malt, chocolate, caramel and black fruits aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel, dried fruits, chocolate, black fruits and ropasted taste. Medium to full body.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle poured to my snifter, showing a cloudy, brown color, with a modest layer of tan head foam, and light spots of lacing. The nose was hints of freezer burn & Band-Aid, then dried fruit, caramel malt, and a touch of smoke. Medium bodied, with low carbonation, the taste continued the aroma notes less the intro, added some tart astringency, earthy bitterness, a touch of leather, sweetness, and fairly hidden alcohol. Not all that impressed.
12oz bottle pours a dark brown color without much head. Low carbonation. Lots of spice.

This is 9 months old. Murky dark brown, mocha coloured head is thin and disappears fast. Not attractive. Aroma is vivid: sweet chocolate base, dark fruits, a slight hint of earthiness. Warming. Taste follows the aroma, a bit less clean with a slight earthy/musty feel. Its mostly sweet but never over the top. Alcohol is very well hidden. Medium body and light to medium carbonation, creamy. Nice and warming, feels like it could use a little improvement

Draught @ 7th Borefts Beer Festival 2015, Brouwerij de Molen, Bodegraven, Netherlands. [ As De Molen / Hair of the Dog Adam ].Unclear dark brown color with a large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, sweet malt, roasted, dark malt, fruity malt, vegetables, dark fruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity malt, dark malt, caramel, dark fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20150925]

Bottle from Bine & Vine. Pours dark brown with no head. Aroma is a little smoky with dark malt and fruit. Med body or so. Flavor is quite smoky, but not in a harsh overpowering way, with chocolate, some medium dark (date/raisin?) fruit. Its also malty. A very different Adam.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours medium brown with a transient beige head and a smoky chocolate aroma. There is a hearty smoked malt flavor with some chocolate and a dry slightly bitter finish. Not at all like HOD Adam.

Overpoweringly sour and ashy, theres just no real balance to this beer, and it tastes tremendously boozy without any other real charm. Reminds me of a Trappist beer but with less harmony in the flavors. Sad to say, this might be a pour-out for me. The flavours arent bad, but theyre just so, so, so strong.

330 ml bottle. Pours a turbid brown with light head. Aromas of brown sugar, light smoke, and toasted malts. Flavors of dark caramel, hickory smoke, and sweet toasted malts. Full, sweet with not too much smoke.

Black body with ruby hints and minimal head on top. Spicy aroma of fusel alcohol and molasses, hints of motor oil infused with coffee. Flavour is molasses and rock candy, sweet and sugary, dry hints of coffee on the finish. Alcohol well hidden but this remains a throat burner of a beer without too much character nor complexity.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy red-brown with a small, short lived, tan head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of overripe dark fruit, caramel malt, spice and leather. Sweet flavour of overripe dark fruit, caramel malt, spice and a hint of smoke with warming alcohol in a dry, bitter finish. Medium to full body with a sticky, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2016 De Molens interpretation of this famous beer, at de Struise Brouwers shop in Brugues. Very thick and dense, ceamy, egg-white, lacing head over a very dark brown beer with bronze hue and burgundy edges, hazy. Strong and fascinating, rich bouquet of elderberry, horse meat, olive, some black chocolate, bayleaf, charcoal touch, dried porcini, leather, liquorish, raisins, sherry. Intense, full taste with candied date sweetness and black olive umaminess well balanced against each other, sourish blackberry touch below, softish carbo, very full, bit oily body of caramelly, nutty and lightly chocolatey malts, spicy accents above, long dry bittersweet finish with some peppery hops providing dryness as well as the expected whisky-like, warming alcohol. A tad unusual just like the regular Adam, but certainly quite different from the original, less full and rounded, less sweet and opulent but still, in its own way, very interesting and satisfying.  Comes across as more German too, with certain Alt (or rather: Sticke) influences.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: A hopped caramel molasses.
Adjunct: Pine, some soy on the nose, deep red colour, some booze (no shit), great lacing.

(Bouteille): Des notes claires de fumée à travers une panoplie de petits fruits comme cerises, dattes et raisins bleus. Laspect cuiré ne fait quun avec le bois fumé et se dilue entièrement dans la richesse des malts sucrés. Il reste un peu de cette astringence dans la finale, quelque peu alcoolisée, et une acidité fruitée sen dégage. Plus fumée, boisée et cuirée que loriginale. Délicieux.

330ml bottle pours a deep amber brown color with a finger of light tan head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is chocolate and caramel with some dark fruits and light roasted grains. Taste is a chocolate and caramel malty sweetness with some dark fruits and light roasted grain bitterness. Medium bodied with mild carbonation.

On tap at the Struise beer shop, Brugge, Belgium. A very dark ruby/brown coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Smokey, caramel, dark fruit aroma. Tastes smokey, caramel, dark fruit, meaty and rich. Nice one.

33 cl bottle from de Bierkoning @ home. Rather dark brown colored, almost opaque. Nice dense beige head, only a thin layer retention. Aromas: sweet, sweet red fruit, hints of smoke and leather. Retronasal its toffee, sweet, light smoke & leather, fruit. Flavor is moderate sweet, fruity, caramel. Rather strong alcohol feel, warming and prickly. Quite full bodied. Soft carbonation. Finish is long, slightly dry, herbal, light bitter.
Bottle at Stuu666s. Pours Darryl brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, booze, oak. Taste is more of the same. Hot finish.
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber, nose is smoky, meaty, caramel, taste is rich, fruity, biscuit, dry, chewy, hot.
Botlle from De Molen. Cloudy, dark amber with a medium tan head. Malty ans smokey tones. Malt, smoke, fruit and hops. Full body with a fruity / smokey finish.

Bottle at De Drie Dorstige Herten, Utrecht. Aroma is sweet dried fruits, figs, dates, chocolate, dark malt, oak, raisins, leather. Flavour is sweet and a bit boozy, alcohol is noticeable. Body is full. Rich and complex beer, very enjoyable.

Beautiful complex ale. Dark red. First smell gives smoke, leather and some faint sweetness. When you taste it is syrupy, a little boozy, lots of complex tastes like raisins, dates, wood, flowers, smoke, chocolate and some pleasant bitterness. Really well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

(De Molen / Hair of the Dog Adam) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 10%
Dark brown red colour on the body, withh a good sized and thick beige head on top. Very good retention.
Aroma of dark fruits, light caramel, dates, raisins, light wood and smoke.
Malty taste with obvious alcohol, dark fruits, caramel, faint smoke, dates, raisins, light toffee.
Medium thick body, nicely carbonated.
Very good!
A: Deep brown, some red colour. One finger light head. N: Liqourice, coffee, oak, bbq T: Floral, wood, liqourice root, coffee O: Very nice! Quite carbonated and packed with flavours!
Bottle from De Molen shop pours dark red brown. Tan head. Lots of dates prunes dark cherry spice old cigar boxes leather saddles. Odd rich. Spices. Interesting full of flavours not really my thing.

Tap at Borefts 2015... Dark brown black... Thick tan head... Soft sweet toffee fruit malt nose.. Dark malts.. Meaty fruits roast malts.. Big woody oak fruit.. Juicy roast... Soft intense ricj sweet woody fruits malts

Bottle, bottled 21-07-2015. Pours deep coppery, slightly hazy, with beige head. Aromas of caramel, sweetness, dried fruits, a bit barley winish. Taste is sweet, with earthy notes, some bitterness, bit of smoke. Very complex, intriguing beer.

Lukt: Krydder, malt og lakris.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum.
Smak: Frukter, chilli, krydder og lakris.

Bottle: Chouffe glass:
Small creamy head. Dark brown body.
Aroma of malts, toast, cinnamon, raisin, light toast, light caramel, some sweet tar and light peppery...
Flavours of malts, alcohol, caramel, bitters, raisin/prunes, dried leaves, light peppery and chalky, some bread/raisin bread, herbs and a woody toffee tint.
Aftertaste is malty, bitter, herbal, toasty and nutty...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to full body.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 33cl bottle at home from de Molen, Bodegraven. Body is black, head is small, beige, small bubbles, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Nose is sweetish, fruity, wineish, slightly smoky roasty, flavor is toast, dark fruits, light smoky whiskey, chocolate, dates, licorice, herb. Heavy sweet, medium to heavy bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium to heavy bittersweet, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Not very heavy dessert beer, quite sweet but great, feels like sweet imperial stout or tripel/quadruple and impartial stout blend, nice one.

Bottle at home (bottled 21-0-/2015). Pours a reddish dark brown with almost no head. Aroma of dark fruits, smoke, wood, alcohol, vanilla, raisins. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, alcohol, caramel, hints of wood, vanilla, smoke, light bitterness, almost chocolate like aftertaste. Very nice. Maybe just a hint too boozy, really need to try the original one.

330 ml bottle at home. Pours cloudy dark brown with a small beige head. Earthy aroma mixed with fruity oak notes. Sweet body with vinious tannins. Bitter sweet finish. High on the toffee and burnt caramel in the taste.

Bottle. Dark brown copper color. Nice aroma of smoke, honey, figs and caramalt. Flavor of caramelised malt, mild smoke, sweet figs, honey and a little iron unfortunately. Nice, but the US original is better.

W aromacie karmel, fenolowe przyprawy, czerwone owoce, trudne do zdefiniowania, trochę belgii, trochę anglii. W smaku fajnie gładkie, półpełne, karmel i przyprawy, ponownie czerwone owoce, skóra, czyli coś na pograniczu dzikości. Dobrze ukryty alkohol. Interesujące i smaczne, ale trochę niezdecydowane.

Bottled. Full 33cl sample. The aroma has ash, light roast, dried fruits, figs, hint of oak. Dark brown, bit reddish coloured beer with almost no head. The taste is moderate sweet, has bitterness, raisin, ash, orange. Very full bodied, bit sticky, very belly-warming. But well quite young, can use some time to balance the high energetic complexity out a bit more.
Drank with Kaspar 12-11-2015. Peculiar, very rich taste. Nice thick body. Leather, smoke, liquorice,... Interesting beer!

Bottle. Teku. Deep brown with tiny, light brown head. Poor lacing and head retention. Aroma is complex - spices, dark fruits, caramel, toffee. Light bitterness with strone malty backbone. Medium to full body, thick/oily texture, soft carbonation, finish is malty with some light bitter notes. In overall not my favourite taste and aroma.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Malty caramelly aroma with hints of smoke and roast. Malty sweet, caramelly flavor, full bodied. Slightly alcoholic. Hint of smoke, beechwood even. Lovely brew.

Bottle. Light hazy deep brown liquid with small to medium light tan head. Aroma of raw sugar, dried fruit, light smoke, toffee, light vanilla, caramel, light banana pie and red berries. Wonderful aroma. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, toffee, chocolate, light smoke and dried fruit. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Super good, on par with the version brewed at Hair of the Dog.

Almost no head, dark-brown beer. Alcohol, fusels, fine strong drinks, wood, finely smoked. Smoked - ashy, on top of sweetish and dark malts, melanoidins, lots of depth. Very well-bodied, alcoholheat; Extremely complex, yet quite balanced beer. Superb!  Thanks to Louis and Mathieu!

Very dark ruby colour, beige head. Aroma of plums, dark fruits, malts, molasses, tobacco, leaves, apple. Taste is light to medium sweet, slight sour note. Slight red apple and clove flavour. Medium body, oily to creamy texture, very soft carbonation.

Bottle thanks to Kenny, split on the train back from BBF 7, day one 25/09/15.
Rich chestnut brown with a light beige covering. 
Nose is toffee, dark fruits, spice, fruit cake.
Taste comprises rich malt, spice, Xmas cake, toffee fudge, dates, raisens. 
Full bodied, fine carbonation, light warming alcohol in the close. 
Solid.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 25th September 2015Borefts VII. Day 1. Keg. And also a bottle on the train home. Hazy deep amber beer, good pale tan head. Palate is airy and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Creamy malts. Touch of caramel - toffee. Spicy fruits and ripe fruits. Little marmalade. Light finish. Rich beer, comes together well.

Thnx to anderfernandez. Pours dark , coca-cola like colored. Small to no white head. Smell is bittersweet; earthy, caramel. Taste is bit bitter, filthy smoke-like, dry, cocoa, Waaw, I remember liking the adam beer, but this one just doesnt pull it, at all...
Süßer holziger Antrunk, etwas herb. Nicht spritzig, immerhin süffig. Aromatisch, für den Alkoholgehalt aber wiederum mild. 11/8/8/7//7

33cl bottle at home. poured a dark brown colour with a tanned head. more carbonation compared to the HOTD beers. notes of sweet dark malts and dark red fruits. smoke, and ash, figs, and a lot of your hotd tobacco. tasty is fairl sweet with a full bodied mouthfeel. very enjoyable

@Borefts 2015, fles na het festival meegenomen van de winkel. gebrouwen bij de Molen. schenkt donkerbruin tot zwart met fijne licht bruine kraag. aroma van rookmout, chocolade, mout, zoet en ham. smaken zijn zacht/glad, redelijk zoet, licht bitter, rookmout, gerookte ham, vanille, alcoholisch, prima smooth mond gevoel, vijgen, rozijnen, caramel, lichte sigaar, redelijk moutig, chocolade, vol en stevig, redelijk tot volle body, plakkerig. mocht van mij nog wel wat complexer qua smaakbeleving, iets té alcoholisch.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2015 Thanks to anderfernandez! 330 ml. bottle sampled. I have had the HotD version about 2  3 times. Usually with some age on it. Pours ruby brown, small mocha head. Nose is syrupy, Doppelbock-like with plenty of fish guts, DE-style, soy sauce, strongly herbal, Taste is fish guts, soy sauce, smoke is surprisingly present (never got any in the regular one), leather, leaves, oily fish guts, Thin oily Doppelbock, Bizarre, like a mediocre Doppelbock, I just dont get what happened here. Nothing at all how I remember the regular version being, this time around for the first time the German connection is evident. I had it draft during Borefts 2015, it was not as good as the regular one but def. way better than this one; Didnt keep notes of that one. Big disappointment this one.

Sampled @ Borefts 2015. Dark brown color with a slight red glare coming through when held into the light. Medium sized beige head. Smell and taste malts, caramel, dark fruits, raisins, brown sugar and some bitterness in the finish. Medium body and carbonation. [Apparently a seperate entry, so moved my Borefts rating here]

Sampled at Borefts 15. Pours very hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, overripe dark fruit, caramel, toffee, woody barrel notes and light veggies. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with very soft carbonation.

Sample courtesy of English ratebeer friends.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear burgundy pour. Some wood notes

Pours very dark brown with a medium tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, caramel, muscovado sugar, raisins, molasses, burnt wood. Taste is roasted and sweet with hardly any bitterness. Mouthfeel is somewhat sticky and oily with low carbonation.
